title: Haridasa Thakura: Acharya of the Holy Name | Sri Jai Chaitanya Dasa | Sri Gaura Mandala Parikrama
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.key_quote: The holy name of Krishna is transcendentally blissful. It bestows all spiritual benedictions, for it is Krishna himself, the reservoir of all pleasure.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the transcendental nature of Krishna's holy name, emphasizing its identity with Krishna himself and its power to bestow spiritual benefits.
segments.transcript: This is a place, a deliverance of prostitute Lakshahira. There is this Madhavi tree nearby here, which Haridas Thakur chanted under, under which he chanted the holy name. The holy name of Krishna is transcendentally blissful. It bestows all spiritual benedictions, for it is Krishna himself, the reservoir of all pleasure. Krishna's name is complete, and it is the form of all transcendental mellows. The holy name of Krishna is not a material name under any condition, and it is no less powerful than Krishna himself. Since Krishna's name is not contaminated by the material qualities, there is no question of its being involved with maya. Krishna's name is always liberated and spiritual. It is never conditioned by the laws of material nature.

segments.key_quote: Haridas Thakur had appeared in the village of Buron and by his mercy the nectar of the holy name became revealed in those blessed lands.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Haridas Thakur and his appearance in Buron, mentioning his pastimes and subsequent move to Puliya near the Ganges.

Haridas Thakur had appeared in the village of Buron and by his mercy the nectar of the holy name became revealed in those blessed lands. After staying many days and manifesting numerous pastimes, Srila Haridas shifted to Puliya, a place situated by the Ganges.

segments.key_quote: Srila Haridas Thakur is the Namacharya of our Sampradaya and is an eternal associate of Lord Gauranga.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Haridas Thakur as the Namacharya, an eternal associate of Lord Gauranga, and an empowered incarnation who propagated the chanting of Krishna's holy names.
segments.transcript: Mahatapa had combinedly incarnated as Haridas Thakur. Srila Haridas Thakur is the Namacharya of our Sampradaya and is an eternal associate of Lord Gauranga. Srila Haridas Thakur had accompanied the Lord in most of his magnanimous pastimes. He was an empowered incarnation of the Supreme Lord, who had appeared just to set an example for all of us to follow. He had delivered innumerable suffering souls by bestowing upon them the nectar of the holy name. Though being born in a family of Muslims, Haridas Thakur widely propagated the chanting of Krishna's holy names to be the supreme spiritual practice and preached how the Lord and His holy names are actually non-different.

segments.transcript: 64 rounds. In the Navadip Dham Mahatmya, Shila Bhaktivinoda Thakur mentions that in the age of Dwapara, Lord Brahma had stolen the cows, cohort boys, and calves from Rindavan with an intention of testing whether Krishna was a Supreme Lord. On realizing that Krishna was indeed his worshipable Supreme Lord, Brahma felt very ashamed. As atonement, he arrived at present-day Mayapur and began meditating upon the blissful form of Gaurahari, Lord Chaitanya, who is none other than Lord Krishna, and became very pleased and knowing the desire of Brahma granted him the boon that he would become an intimate associate of the Lord when he would next appear in this material world. segments.summary: The speaker discusses Haridas Thakur's birthplace in Buron, Bangladesh, and addresses the conflicting accounts regarding his birth in a Muslim family, affirming the scriptural account.
